title.narrative: Emergency nutrition services in COVID-19 high risk districts of Balkh, Kunduz and Faryab provinces

description.narrative:
In the proposed project, Save the Children (SC) will implement emergency nutrition and health services in four COVID-19 high risk districts of Balkh (Mazar-i-Sharif), Kunduz (Kunduz city and Imam Sahib) and Faryab (Maimana) provinces. These districts are prioritized under the COVID-19 Multisectoral Humanitarian Country Plan. The project will deploy four mobile health and nutrition teams (MHNTs) in the four priority districts (one in each district) to provide outpatient services for the management of severely and moderately acute malnourished (OPD-SAM and OPD-MAM) boys and girls (six to 59 months), management of acutely malnourished pregnant and lactating women (PLW), infant and young child feeding in emergency (IYCF-E) services, primary and reproductive health and basic psychosocial support services with the focus on under five years old children and PLW. To build resilience of vulnerable groups at borderline of acute malnutrition, children at risk of malnutrition with MUAC gt12.5 - lt13.5 will be targeted for integrated IYCF-E response. The project will provide Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and Infection Prevention and Control (IPC) supplies to MHNTs, and hygiene kits for PLW to prevent/reduce transmission of COVID-19 in health workers, beneficiaries and PLW. Use of mothers/caregivers MUAC will be strengthened to further improve the quality of screening and early diagnosis, and reduce exposure. Based on the needs assessments, the project will develop a capacity building plan with the focus on MHNT staff training on integrated management of acute malnutrition (IMAM), IYCF-E, Nutrition Cluster guidance on IMAM and IYCF programming in the context of COVID-19, IPC in the context of COVID-19, Psychosocial First Aid (PFA) and gender equality. For MHNT staff capacity building, tele-communication system will be considered (if physical training is not possible). Additionally, the project will strengthen dissemination of key information/messages to promote and support optimal IYCF-E, good hygiene, psychosocial wellbeing, and positive coping strategies in the context of COVID-19 using different platforms/communication channels that include: printing and dissemination of IEC materials, radio, community announcement, IVR mass messaging and social media.
In the implementation of the proposed interventions, SC will consider Nutrition Cluster’s guide on IMAM and IYCF program adaptation in the context of COVID-19, and SC’s operational SOP for MHNTs in the context of COVID-19 that focuses on physical adaptation of MHNTs, crowd control, IPC, identification of COVID-19 suspected cases, and staff safety. The proposed action will target 36,000 direct beneficiaries including 20,178 women and girls. The timeline for the action is from 1 June, 2020 until 30 November, 2020. SC will implement this project in coordination with all relevant actors at the national, provincial and community levels to ensure effective and timely management of the proposed interventions.
